mapper.sql:
FROM sys_depart INNER JOIN sys_user_depart ON sys_user_depart.dep_id = sys_depart.id INNER JOIN sys_user ON sys_user.id = sys_user_depart.user_id WHERE
sys_user.del_flag = 0 AND sys_depart.org_code LIKE #{bindOrgCode}
AND sys_user.realname LIKE concat(concat('%',#{userParams.realname}),'%')
AND sys_user.work_no LIKE concat(concat('%',#{userParams.workNo}),'%')
mapper.select:
SELECT sys_user.id AS id, sys_user.realname AS realname, sys_user.avatar AS avatar, sys_user.work_no AS workNo, sys_user.post AS post, sys_user.telephone AS telephone, sys_user.email AS email, sys_user.phone AS phone, sys_depart.id AS departId, sys_depart.depart_name AS departName
ORDER BY sys_depart.org_code ASC
mapper.update: UPDATE sys_user SET del_flag = 0, update_by = #{entity.updateBy}, update_time = #{entity.updateTime} WHERE del_flag = 1 AND id IN (${userIds})
mapper.delete: DELETE FROM sys_user WHERE del_flag = 1 AND id IN (${userIds})
mapper.select: SELECT su.username, su.realname, sd.depart_name AS departName, case when sd.parent_id is null or sd.parent_id = "" then sd.depart_name when sd1.parent_id is null or sd1.parent_id = "" then sd1.depart_name when sd2.parent_id is null or sd2.parent_id = "" then sd2.depart_name when sd3.parent_id is null or sd3.parent_id = "" then sd3.depart_name when sd4.parent_id is null or sd4.parent_id = "" then sd4.depart_name else '' end company FROM sys_user su LEFT JOIN sys_depart sd ON su.depart_ids = sd.id LEFT JOIN sys_depart sd1 on sd.parent_id = sd1.id LEFT JOIN sys_depart sd2 on sd1.parent_id = sd2.id LEFT JOIN sys_depart sd3 on sd2.parent_id = sd3.id LEFT JOIN sys_depart sd4 on sd3.parent_id = sd4.id WHERE su.username = #{query.username}

SELECT su.id, su.username, su.realname FROM sys_role sr left join sys_user_role sur on sr.id = sur.role_id left join sys_user su on sur.user_id = su.id where sr.role_code = #{roleCode} and su.del_flag = '0' and su.`status` = '1'
and FIND_IN_SET(#{subject},su.rel_tenant_ids)

SELECT DISTINCT sp.perms FROM sys_user su inner join sys_user_role sur on su.id = sur.user_id inner join sys_role_permission srp on sur.role_id = srp.role_id inner join sys_permission sp on srp.permission_id = sp.id where sp.perms = #{s} and su.username = #{username}

SELECT GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT sp.perms) as perms FROM sys_user su inner join sys_user_role sur on su.id = sur.user_id inner join sys_role_permission srp on sur.role_id = srp.role_id inner join sys_permission sp on srp.permission_id = sp.id where su.username = #{username} and sp.menu_type = '2' group by su.username
SELECT GROUP_CONCAT(sr.role_code) AS role_code FROM sys_user_role sur LEFT JOIN sys_role sr ON sur.role_id = sr.id where sur.user_id = #{userId} GROUP BY sur.user_id
